workflow.name: Generate AI-powered morning briefs from ClickUp to Slack and Gmail with GPT-4o
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate your team's daily stand-ups with AI-powered morning briefs, directly pulled from ClickUp tasks and shared via Slack and Gmail every morning. ‚òÄÔ∏èüìãüí¨

## What This Template Does
- Triggers automatically at 9:15 AM each morning via cron. ‚è∞
- Fetches the latest sprint and all active or due-today tasks from ClickUp.
- Categorizes tasks by status, priority, and assignee for clear visibility.
- Uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4o to generate a detailed, structured morning summary.
- Formats the AI summary into a clean HTML email and a Slack post.
- Sends automated updates to Gmail and Slack channels.
- Includes real-time error detection and Slack alerts for quick debugging.

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Eliminates manual stand-up prep by generating AI-driven daily reports.
 ‚úÖ Keeps teams aligned with clear task summaries and blocker tracking.
 ‚úÖ Automatically distributes updates across Slack and Gmail.
 ‚úÖ Provides HTML-formatted emails and Slack markdown summaries.
 ‚úÖ Reduces time spent on daily check-ins and sprint reviews.

## Features
- Fully automated daily scheduling using cron triggers.
- Real-time task fetching and categorization from ClickUp.
- GPT-4-powered summarization for executive-style briefs.
- Responsive HTML email builder for beautiful reports.
- Slack integration for quick, shareable updates.
- Error handling with dedicated Slack notifications.

## Requirements
- ClickUp OAuth2 credentials for task access.
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4o API credentials for summary generation.
- Slack API credentials for channel posting.
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials for sending email reports.

## Target Audience
- Project managers and team leads needing automated daily briefings üë©‚Äçüíº
- Development teams using ClickUp for sprint and task tracking üíª
- Agencies or operations teams coordinating across tools üîÑ
- Remote teams seeking quick alignment and productivity boosts üåç

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect your ClickUp account via OAuth2 and update Team, Space, and Folder IDs. ‚öôÔ∏è
- Add Azure OpenAI GPT-4o credentials for AI summary generation. ü§ñ
- Configure Slack OAuth2 credentials and set the target channel ID. üí¨
- Connect Gmail OAuth2 and define recipient email addresses. üìß
- Customize the schedule trigger time (default: 9:15 AM). üïí
- Test the workflow to verify proper data retrieval and message delivery. üöÄ

workflow.name: Automate Daily Morning Brief Generation from ClickUp to Slack and Gmail using GPT-4

parameters.content:
## üåÖ Automate Daily Morning Brief Generation from ClickUp to Slack and Gmail using GPT-4
This workflow automatically generates a comprehensive morning brief from your ClickUp tasks and sends it to Slack and Email every morning.

### **What it does:**
- Fetches the latest active sprint from ClickUp
- Retrieves all tasks due today and in-progress items
- Uses AI to generate an executive summary
- Sends formatted briefs to Slack and Gmail
- Handles errors with notifications

### **Use Case:**
Perfect for teams using ClickUp for sprint management who want automated daily stand-up reports with:
- Today's priorities and due tasks
- In-progress work status
- Team member assignments
- Blockers and issues

### **Setup Requirements:**
1. ClickUp OAuth2 credentials
2. Slack API credentials
3. Gmail OAuth2 credentials  
4. Azure OpenAI API credentials
5. Update Team ID, Space ID, and Folder ID in ClickUp nodes
6. Configure Slack channel IDs
7. Set recipient email address

### **Schedule:**
Runs daily at 9:15 AM (customizable in Schedule Trigger node)

## ‚è∞ Schedule Trigger

**Purpose:** Triggers the workflow every morning at 9:15 AM

**Configuration:**
- Uses cron expression: `15 9 * * *`
- Runs Monday through Sunday
- Timezone: Server default

**To Customize:**
- Change hour/minute in cron expression
- Add day-of-week restrictions if needed

## üìã Fetch Sprint Lists

**Purpose:** Retrieves all sprint lists from ClickUp

**Configuration Required:**
- **Team ID:** Replace `9016683627` with your team ID
- **Space ID:** Replace `90162844741` with your space ID  
- **Folder ID:** Replace `90164394824` with your folder ID

**How to find IDs:**
1. Open ClickUp in browser
2. Navigate to your space/folder
3. Copy IDs from URL

**Output:** List of all sprints with metadata

## ‚úÖ Validation Check

**Purpose:** Ensures sprint lists were retrieved successfully

**Logic:**
- Checks if response is not empty
- Only proceeds if lists exist

**Error Handling:**
- If no lists found, workflow stops
- Prevents downstream errors

## üîç Find Active Sprint

**Purpose:** Identifies the current active sprint or most recent one

**Logic:**
1. Checks for sprints where current time falls between start and due dates
2. If active sprint exists, selects it
3. If no active sprint, selects most recent by start date

**Output:**
- Sprint ID, name, dates
- Active status flag
- Total sprint count

## üì• Get Sprint Tasks

**Purpose:** Fetches all tasks from the active sprint

**Filters Applied:**
- Tasks due today (midnight to 11:59 PM)
- Includes subtasks and checklist items

**Note:** Team/Space/Folder IDs are dynamically pulled from previous node

**Output:** Complete task data with assignees, status, priorities, and subtasks

## üìä Format Task Data

**Purpose:** Transforms raw ClickUp data into structured format for AI processing

**Processing:**
- Extracts checklist items as subtasks
- Categorizes tasks by status and priority
- Groups in-progress, urgent, high, and normal priority tasks
- Identifies blockers
- Calculates status summaries

**Output:** Structured JSON with task categorizations and metadata

## ü§ñ AI Brief Generation

**Purpose:** Uses Azure OpenAI to generate executive summary

**Components:**
- **LLM:** GPT-4o model
- **Memory:** Buffer window for context
- **Parser:** Structured JSON output

**Input:** Formatted task data
**Output:** Executive summary with priorities, team focus, and blockers

**Setup Required:**
- Configure Azure OpenAI credentials
- Model should be GPT-4o or equivalent

options.systemMessage:
=You are a professional executive assistant creating detailed morning briefs for a team.
Your response must:
- Be structured, actionable, and team-focused
- Highlight in-progress tasks and blockers prominently
- Group tasks by assignee/team member
- Show clear priorities with due dates
- Include subtask progress where available
- Be concise but comprehensive
- Focus on TODAY's tasks and priorities
- Use the exact date provided in the input data

Always output valid JSON matching the exact schema provided.
Never add markdown fences, code blocks, or explanatory text.

parameters.content:
## üìß Email Formatting

**Purpose:** Converts AI output to beautiful HTML email

**Features:**
- Professional gradient header
- Responsive table design
- Priority task numbering
- Team member cards
- Blocker status indicators
- Mobile-friendly layout

**Output:** HTML and plain text versions

## üí¨ Slack Notification

**Purpose:** Posts brief summary to Slack channel

**Configuration Required:**
- **Channel ID:** Replace `C09GNB90TED` with your channel ID
- Get channel ID from Slack channel details

**Features:**
- Markdown formatting
- Clickable ClickUp board link
- Concise summary format

**Setup:** Configure Slack OAuth2 credentials

## üì® Gmail Delivery

**Purpose:** Sends formatted HTML email via Gmail

**Configuration Required:**
- **Recipient Email:** Replace `herevivekpatidar@gmail.com` with recipient
- Can send to multiple recipients (comma-separated)

**Email Content:**
- HTML version with styling
- Plain text fallback
- Dynamic subject line

**Setup:** Configure Gmail OAuth2 credentials

## üö® Error Handling System

**Purpose:** Catches workflow failures and sends alerts

**Error Trigger:**
- Activates when any node fails
- Captures error details and context

**Slack Alert:**
- Posts to dedicated error channel
- Includes error message, failed node name, and timestamp
- Allows quick debugging

parameters.jsCode:
// N8N Code Node - Enhanced Morning Brief HTML Email Formatter const inputData = $input.all()[0].json.output; // Helper function to parse priorities into structured data function parsePriorities(text) { const lines = text.split('\n').filter(line => line.trim().startsWith('-')); return lines.map(line => { const cleanLine = line.replace(/^-\s*/, '').trim(); const match = cleanLine.match(/^(.+?)\s*\(([^)]+)\)$/); if (match) { return { task: match[1].trim(), assignee: match[2].trim() }; } return { task: cleanLine, assignee: '' }; }); } // Helper function to parse team focus by person function parseTeamFocus(text) { const sections = text.split(/(?=[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+:)/); return sections.filter(s => s.trim()).map(section => { const [name, ...tasks] = section.split(':'); return { name: name.trim(), tasks: tasks.join(':').trim() }; }); } const priorities = parsePriorities(inputData.todaysPriorities); const teamMembers = parseTeamFocus(inputData.teamFocus); const html = ` ${inputData.title}

üìã ${inputData.title}

üìä EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

${inputData.executiveSummary}

üéØ TODAY'S PRIORITIES (${priorities.length} Tasks)

${priorities.map((priority, index) => ` `).join('')}
# Task Description Assigned To
${index + 1} ${priority.task} ${priority.assignee}

‚ö° IN PROGRESS HIGHLIGHTS

${inputData.inProgressHighlights}

üë• TEAM FOCUS & ASSIGNMENTS

${teamMembers.map((member, index) => ` `).join('')}

üë§ ${member.name}

${member.tasks}

${inputData.blockers.toLowerCase().includes('all clear') ? '‚úÖ' : '‚ö†Ô∏è'} BLOCKERS & ISSUES

${inputData.blockers}

üîó VIEW FULL BOARD ON CLICKUP

ü§ñ This brief was automatically generated by N8N Automation
Have a productive day! üöÄ

`; // Enhanced plain text version const plainText = `${inputData.title} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ üìä EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ${inputData.executiveSummary} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ üéØ TODAY'S PRIORITIES (${priorities.length} Tasks) ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ${priorities.map((p, i) => `${i + 1}. ${p.task} ‚Üí ${p.assignee}`).join('\n')} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ‚ö° IN PROGRESS HIGHLIGHTS ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ${inputData.inProgressHighlights} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ üë• TEAM FOCUS & ASSIGNMENTS ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ${teamMembers.map(m => `üë§ ${m.name}\n ${m.tasks}`).join('\n\n')} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ${inputData.blockers.toLowerCase().includes('all clear') ? '‚úÖ' : '‚ö†Ô∏è'} BLOCKERS & ISSUES ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ ${inputData.blockers} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ View Full Board: ${inputData.clickupBoardUrl} ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ`; return { json: { html: html, subject: `üìã ${inputData.title}`, plainText: plainText } };

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

generic.label: Creating Error Workflows in n8n

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
